unit: Unit 4 | Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions
title: The Relationship Between Tossing a Coin and Buying a Large Coffee
question_text:
Suppose $A$ is the random variable that represents the number of times a tossed coin will land on “heads” in $8\text{ tosses}$. Also, suppose $B$ is the random variable that represents the number of ounces in each of $8$ randomly selected large cups of coffee from the nearby donut shop.
Which of the following best describes the relationship between $A$ and $B$?

choices.text: $A$ and $B$ are independent random variables. Their probability distributions should not be related to each other in any way.
$A$ and $B$ are dependent random variables since we are looking at the same number of observations for both.
$A$ and $B$ are both discrete random variables.
$A$ and $B$ are both continuous random variables.
$A$ and $B$ are mutually exclusive random variables.
